alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:41PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Stone, southeastern Searcy and northern Van Buren Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 941 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rocky Hill, or 9 miles south of Marshall, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton... Kay... Bohannon... Elba... Woolum... Imo... Rocky Hill... Old Lexington... Elberta... Watts... Leslie... Oxley... Chimes... Flag... Arlberg... Fox... Dennard... Timbo... Botkinburg... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations
